Authors:
Siriporn Pota, Sinchai Chatasiri, Jintana - Unartngam,
Yuichi Yamaoka, Kentaro Hosaka, Yoshitaka Ono
Title:
Taxonomic identity of a Phakopsora fungus causing the
grapevine leaf rust disease in Southeast Asia and Australasia.
Abstract:
Three distinct groups were revealed among the grapevine
leaf rust fungi from Japan, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia, East Timor
and Australia in phylograms generated from sequence analyses of the SSU
rDNA ITS 2 region including 5.8S and the LSUrDNAD1/D2 region. A group of
Thai, Malaysian-Indonesian and East Timorese-Australianfungus was
distinct from twoother groups of grapevine leaf rust fungi, P.
meliosmae-myrianthae and P. montana,distributed in temperate East Asia.
Although complete life cycle and native host plants are unknown for the
Southeast Asian and Australasian fungus, it is likely to be a
biologically distinct species.
